lowcountries ſeated upon side hill laſt germany ſtoops upon river woal waſheth lower part town divide betow iſland lying upon flat low ground woal old rhine eſteemed ancient seat thoſe people roman called batavians bravery love liberty took confederacy ſubjected neighbouring part gaul germany ſtands south arheim two league diſtant ſix vtretch eaſt three clef weſt twenty cologn ſame year 1591 foot moſt serene confederate one hand french monarch ſingle mediation charles ii king great britain pope much delay many debate laſt rejected party concerned negotiation treaty ſpun great length together intervening action war ſhall endeavour give clear ſatisfactory view conſiſtent nature circumſtance thing compatible deſign treatiſe extends ſelf much even preſent time congreſs may ſaid opened time arrival two engliſh mediatorsjuly 1676 sir william temple sir lionel jenkins upon place treaty found two party engaged war preſent viz french dutch plenipotentiary former exceeding eager ſet negotiation foot therefore pretended quickly enter upon point term great confidence one mediator upon matter gave light whole deſign france main procure separate peace poſſible holland intervention prince orange without thought could well effected found nail would drive way quickly turned battery upon penſionary fagel tho little hope succeſs latter ſhew ſo much forwardneſs matter french ſoon arrival demanding audience mediator declared came make offer exhibiting full power hand doubting ſaid dutch ready ſame upon acquainted overture replied choice french embaſſadors pleaſed conceive haſtening would gain time ſince order make pace without previous concert ally conſequently tho french ſhould yet would preſent neither exhibit make reflection might neceſſary upon thoſe french gave french occaſion preſs extreamly upon making inſtances ally haſten treaty elſe declare would enter upon negotiation without intimating withal maſter reſolved recal much longer delay dutch promiſed acquaint state endeavour diſpoſe fix ſome time expect order accordingly mean ally found took many occaſions could delaying diſpatch miniſters congreſs hope hindring dutch proceeding without sovereignty excepting ſuch way agreed upon treaty 1661 paſs frontier france alſatia ſuch way ſhall neceſſary paſs france nancy france metz briſac franche compte upon condition nevertheleſs make ſome compenſation town nancy majeſty ſhall reſtore toul conſiderable extent situation much reſpect biſhoprick majeſty demand likewiſe longwic provoſtſhip quitted offereth withal recompenſe prince lorrain another provoſtſhip equal value one three biſhopricks whereas marſal quitted majeſty particular treaty preſent part lorrain ſo underſtood compriſed reſtitution theſe term may ought make platform general peace upon majeſty hath long ago declared himſelf king great britain majeſty deſires may imparted aſſembly nimeguen plenipotentiary propoſe conſideration reſt containing loweſt condition admit upon enemy may make choice either war peace given st germains 9th apr 1678 imperialiſts others ſeemed leaſt inclinable yield foregoing condition strain requiring full satisfaction sweden inſupportable party increaſing daily laſt 3d may year brake barbarous act murdering dr sharp archbiſhop st andrew party covenanters beſides ſeverity uſed towards ſince exaltation dignity made himſelf obnoxious rage becauſe great zealot presbyterianchurchgovernment eſteemed perjured apoſtate prelate villain perſecutor godly betrayer jeſus chriſt church general accuſation ſome nation farther confidently affirmd king ſent pardon ſome offender ſame falling sharp hand villanouſly concealed till execution done upon friend deceasd able procure satisfaction according ordinary courſe law intereſt authority neceſſitated recourſe extraordinary method tho thing begin end ſo fact proving prelude followed upon 29th ſame month party 80 theſe covenanters met place called rugland well mounted armed firſt proclaimed covenant burnt following act viz act concerning king supremacy receſſory act whereby law made king exile repealed act eſtabliſhing epiſcopacy act appointing anniverſary 29th may sunday june 1ſt rendevouzd 1500 men upon snoudenhill foot commanded one wyer horſe robert hambleton one parron aſſiſtance balfour hackſtock two laſt number thoſe aſſaſſinated archbiſhop hence proceeded took city glaſcow publiſhed two proclamation effect officer covenanted armythe scotch rebel proclamation require command inhabitant burgh glaſcow furniſh u 24 cart 60 horſes removing proviſions place camp whereever ſhall ſet abide u end pleaſure pain reputed enemy proceeded againſt accordingly officer covenanted armytheir second proclamation require command magiſtrates glaſcow extend baniſh forth thereof archbiſhops biſhops curate wife bearns servant family perſons concerned king army within 48 hour publiſhing hereof highest pain publiſhed long declaration taking arm free general aſſembly free unlimited parliament redreſs manifold grievance therein enumerated humbly requeſted majeſty reſtore thing found god brought home crown kingdom mean time council edenburg idle raiſed army quartered place called blackburn prevent covenanters approach edenburg gave king account paſſed expecting majeſtys order thereupon whereupon king diſpatchd away duke monmouth scotland wonderful celerity joyned army 22th june approach towards covenanters lay little park hamilton thereabouts choſen advantageous ground paſſage stonebridge called bothwelbridge barricadced welllined muſketeers notice duke march good order great silence guard length diſcovered lighted match took alarm thereupon put themſelves fighting poſture major oglethorp dragoon order poſt himſelf near bridge duke drew army upon hill fronted hamiltonpark river enemy mile bridge covenanters drawn two diſtinct body mile aſunder ſmalleſt whereof lay near bridge hard campthey make propoſals duke monmouth poſture ſide duke ſooner come oglethorps poſt came one david hume covenanters preſented declaration together petition ſigned robert hamilton name covenanted army arm wherein prayed term declaration might made good ſafe conduct granted ſome number addreſs themſelves duke matter duke anſwered would treat upon declaration would readily lay arm would receive king mercy anſwer went back deſiring ſome time deliberate upon duke granted half hour return ſent paper drummer repreſenting informed grace came england term offered deſired know propoſe might adviſe whether term ſuch could accept whereupon duke finding trifled ſent word would receive meſſages thing paſſed thus duke themthe duke monmouth fight rout covenanters cannon ſome horſe foot brought body army poſted far bridge immediately commanded play ſooner perceived covenanters threw themſelves upon ground avoid shot thoſe poſted bridge fired firſt briskly five ſix shot cannon ran away upon riſingground running firſt duke advanced men ſeizing upon bridge threw barricadoes stone cartwheel like river took one piece cannon purſued hill covenanters perceiving number ſmall rallied faced yet would venture come upon tho duke men retired back bridge mean time duke paſſed army bridge drew riſingground took ſome time upon covenanters advanced good order time enough ſo upon approach eſpying cannon head duke army immediately ſifted order opened middle thinking twas ſuppoſed obliged ſhoot ſtreight forward yet cannon turned upon ſtood 3 4 time diſcharged began run commander robert hamilton one firſt dragoon advancing upon perfect rout flying purſued way 7 800 brought thing quiet 23th sunſet french ship gallies came near ſeverely batterd town 7 hour together mean time landed 500 men weſtward another body eaſt ſide city ſo warmly received forced laſt return march halt monday fifth june came within • aif mile neuheuſel▪ twas thought deſign attack place informed 10th garriſons peſt budae conſiſted 8000 men force beſides ſave 2 3 thouſand tartar encamped regiment horſe command ſome foot duke 14th ſent 500 men count •• rum went directly vicegrade vicegrade beſieged taken imperialiſts turkiſh paſs ſtrong mountainous fortreſs danube artillery arrived piece canon 16th day long evening ſtormed enemy enduring forced flee caſtle adjacent mountain found ſecurity neither caſtle ſo bombed next day noon began capitulate happened ſo condition could agreed action already hapned briefly thus turk upon approach gra • noon appeared ſounded allarm whereupon general halliwel much miſtaken number went poſted himſelf upon left hand betwixt two mountain ſtronger thought drawn form half moon advancing deſign incloſe made think retiring proved late killed though lieutenant collonel rab ••• could relieve falling upon enemy great fury drove back purſued 5 mile place advantageous poſt rallied action came greater loſs chriſtians vicegrade duke lorain directed march way gran barkan towards waiſen ſending colonel h • uſter 500 horſe view poſture enemy monday 26th brought intelligence turk advancing towards waiſen hollow way whereupon duke continued march next day arrived plain waiſen enemy 15000 ſtrong appeared drawn battallia right wing flanked janizaries ſtood upon mountain left drew towards city made duke put himſelf immediately poſture defence flanking cavalry infantry hardly done enemy diſcharged 5 piece cannon great fury ſeveral time upon imperialiſts right wing without damage ſo quitted station fell briskly upon left ſoon beaten back great diſorder confuſion towards right ſo warmly plied german cannon immediately retired horſe towards peſt many foot ſaved themſelves city loſt 1000 among one baſha little loſs german eſpecially ſince duke lorain eſcaped ſo well though ſo narrowly horſe ſhot neck engagement conſequence succeſs firing ſome cannon surrender waiſen upon diſcretion hence army marched towards peſt garriſoned place 2000 foot 500 curaſſiers 300 dragoon monday 10th july whole army got danube encamped place called st andrew left wing ſecured danube right unacceſſible mountain right againſt broad long marſh enemy advanced towards noon divided themſelves 2 wing leaving great marſh middle fell great noiſe fury upon german whoſe cavalry thereupon little advanced upon left wing immediately ordered back duke command mean time turk beaten back chriſtians watch prince salm commanded rearguard ſtoutly oppoſed reinforced battallion infantry ſome piece cannon duke utterly routed purſued near upon 2 mile turk rallied fell great fury upon right wing tho continued 〈◊〉 20 piece cannon german planted quickly portreſs ſituated mouth gulf preveſa little neck land ſtrong well fortified sea one ſide great moral however light veſſels enterd port damata 21ſt force landed ſide place ſame time done captaingeneral time 23d fleet began batter place great succeſs becauſe high wind yet next day whole fleet ſo diſpoſed moſt execution cannon galleaſſes advanced within muſquetſhot fortreſs threw great many bomb fireball good succeſs tho themſelves received ſome damage gun enemy neither force landed idle part 25th finiſhed battery 20 piece cannon next day another ſomewhat nearer eaſtſide town raiſed one alſo weſtward day following wherewith made breach wall wherein however diſturbed sally turk quickly beaten back yet ſo took care defend themſelves within 1ſt aug filled breach sack straw bale wool yet chriſtians ruined cannon advanced trench counterſcarp 2d thought advanced farther found breach filled made deſcend ditch third part whereof filled 3d night faggot morning made 2 deſcents ditch cannon made large breach diſmounted cannon place greatly incommoded beſiegedthe venetian take sanctum maura excluded relief every way ſince sieur manata poſted 600 men ſide preveſa ſhut way alſo wherefore security governed private intereſt perſonal greatneſs thoſe rule government hath always eſteemed beſt supream magiſtrates inveſted power prerogative might capacitate preſerve people violence oppreſſion promote proſperity yet nothing belong rule conſtitution might enable injure oppreſs hath glory england moſt nation prince intruſted neceſſary either advancing welfare people protection diſcharge office withal ſtood ſo limited reſtrained fundamental term conſtitution without violation oath well rule meaſures government could hurt exerciſe act authority adminiſtration ſuch hand ſtood obnoxious puniſhed caſe tranſgreſſed according primitive frame government prerogative crown privilege subject ſo far juſtling one another right reſerved unto people tended render king honourable great prerogative ſettled prince order subject protection▪ safety humane thing ſubject perverſion well decay hath fate engliſh government often changed wreſted firſt settlement inſtitution particularly compelled ſay boundary government late broken nothing left unattempted turning limited monarchy abſolute tyranny ſuch hath tranſaction affair within nation ſeveral year laſt paſt though proteſtant religion liberty people fenced hedged many law wiſdom man could deviſe preſervation againſt popery arbitrary power religion hath along countermined popiſh counſels privilege raviſhed u fraud violence eſpecially whole courſe series life hath one continued conſpiracy againſt reformed religion right nation whoever conſiders contriving burning london inſtigating confederacy france war holland earl eſſex cauſing thoſe others clandeſtinely cut hope conceal adviſing procuring prorogation diſſolution parliament order prevent looking crime might eſcape juſtice nation imagine nothing ſo black horrid ſelf ſo ruinous deſtructive religion kingdom may expect tyranny hath exerciſed ſince ſnatched crown brother head leave none poſſibility flattering themſelves hope safety▪ eithor conſciencies hath impowerd exerciſe idolatry beſides daily preſent worſhip maſs hath publickly aſſiſted greateſt • opperies superſtition neither hath tender trampling upon law concern property ſeeing two happily got gran ſame day seraſquier baſha army 50 60000 men begun beſiege place immediately thereupon called council war many opinion governour gran ſo well provided could eaſily defend town two month beſt way vigorouſly purſue siege newheuſel meddle withthe turkiſh army till ſomething weakned themſelves gran majority concluded moſt adviſable march greateſt part army fight turk leave ſufficient body carry ſame time siege newheuſel whereupon officer ſent vienna acquaint emperor ſaid reſolution returned 3d camp emperor approbation reſolved duke mean time ordered ſeveral retrenchment made greater ſecurity thoſe left continue siege almoſt finiſhed 5th auguſt began march day ſhall preſent follow duke lorrain march give account iſſue return newheuſell aug 8 paſſed danube near comorra next day reached dotis otherwiſe called thaſa whence highneſs elector bavaria advanced towards enemy deſign attack camp gran▪ came fight approached nearer underſtood vigorouſly turk puſhed siege gran hereupon duke ordered general aſſault made 27th much bravery obſtinate fighting ſide german fixed lodgment upon firſt wall prepared approach 30th ſent another summons ſurrender anſwered day following veterani puſhed siege great vigour though garriſon made ſtout reſiſtance proviſions grew ſcarce camp adding difficulty aroſe seaſon began render enterprize hazardous care grand viſier took▪ occaſioned together forementioned inconveniencies proving uneaſie general wallis called council war wherein reſolved general veterani ſhould ſent detachment attack turk expected reinforcement came purſuance reſolution veterani 19th night marched 10 regiment made together 5000 men night long though dark got within mile half enemy light fire made drew battalia 2 line firſt commanded col st croy baron de ghotz order advanced towards enemy camp hoping ſurprize break day happened darkneſs night squadron fell ſome diſorder noiſe made gave alarm tartar outguard however general continued march silence conduct could break day fell tartar quarter col ghotz 3 regiment forced turk battel scinta made great slaughter took diver priſoners underſtood tartar 7000 ſtrong enemy ſooner abandoned camp german soldier fell plunder notwithſtanding ſtrict order given general contrary turk tartar obſerving rallied returning great fury fell upon general veterani preſent forced retreat 3 squadron would great danger col st croix haſted regiment aſſiſtance followed col caſtelli 3 regiment got together great haſte renewed fight great ſharpneſs laſt enemy routed fled yet much purſued veterani thinking enough pillage camp return segedin upon accordingly however march perceiving great body horſe upon left much ſurprized thinking way eſcape left reſolute immediately drew troop battalia advanced towards turk acceſſible one ſide yet upon ſevere summons ſhewing mercy garriſon reſiſted gave place next day leaving 20 piece braſs cannon 23 iron 7 mortar venetian liberty 200 chriſtian slave hence general seraſquier body 10000 turk marching relief general coninſmark june 14 leaving ſufficient number troop guard work marched meet endeavoured 3 ſeveral time engage battel could turk paſſing river retiring advantageous ground upon force count coninſmark reinforced 14000 men board fleet reſolved paſs river 2 place attack enemy front flank performed accordingly fight obſtinate succeſs doubtful 2 hour laſt turk fell confuſion fled leaving near 1000 ſlain diver priſoners behind tent cannon baggage 37 killed 60 wounded chriſtians good succeſs attended blowing 150 garriſon navdrino new navarino ſurrenderd among baſha quantity powder took fire bomb occaſioned surrendry place chriſtians took poſſeſſion june 17 found 63 piece cannon 13 mortar great quantity ammunition therein venetian courage thus heightned train succeſſes nothing would ſerve turn siege modon conſiderable place morea southern shoar modon beſieged venetian captaingeneral reſolved upon tho knew seraſquier reinforced garriſon provided thing neceſſary defence purpoſe arrived june 22 town men landed ſame day general coninſmark place inveſted next battery raiſed againſt plaid good succeſs till 27th another battery 7 mortar finiſhed summons ſent captaingeneral commanding baſha ſurrender appeared yet ſtiff enough siege went 28th trench carried within 50 pace ditch notwithſtanding continual oppoſition made enemy great ſmall shot alſo july 1ſt made sally ſoon repulled beſiegers proceeded vigorouſly work ſame time ſent party diſcover poſture seraſquier informed promiſed bring turk relief 6th could learn news 5th▪ lodged themſelves counterſcarp began fill ditch already great breach made wall thing preparing aſſault 6th prevented inhabitant terrified execution bombssurrendred time laid great part town aſhes promiſed succour appearing obliged baſha capitulate 7th marched number 3000 men leaving venetian caſtle town near 100 piece cannon ſorts 13 mortar beſides ammunition proviſion whereof great quantity seaſon ſtill moſt proper action captaingeneral well knowing way ſo well heighten glory conqueſtsnapoli di romania beſieged purſue ſtill ſuch method ſhould beſt ſecuring reſolved lay siege leſs conſiderable place napoli di romania ancient nauplia ſituated upon eaſtern shoar morea got force sea land readineſs ſet ſail modon july 13 got clara place 6 mile diſtant napoli di romania ordered force land next day poſſeſſed themſelves hill palameda within musketſhot town began attack place ſide yet could prevent seraſquier lay body 9000 men far reinforce 2 day garriſon 300 men conſiſted leſs 2000 command muſtapha baſha seraſquier content advanced towards venetian camp 6th general coninſmark ſo far declining battel left force ſufficient guard work town marched 2 mile camp meet ſome light skirmiſhes 2 body engaged turk hold long loſt 400 men retired general ſoon went back camp quickly poſſeſt himſelf caſtles argo gemini mean time puſhd siege imaginable vigour till 19th seraſquier reinforced 3000 freſh men approached ſecond time towards venetian camp beſieged ſame time making sally upon venetian drove furiouſly back town gave ſo warm entertainment seraſquier cannon planted upon hill palameda obliged go without making attempt upon line gave chriſtians opportunity purſue siege 23d lodge themſelves ditch town maintain poſt received information ſame day seraſquier reinforced granadeers made alſo ſecond attack ſide river like succeſs imperialiſts entring town way cut piece greateſt part thoſe found arm reſt made eſcape caſtle though firſt made shew defending yet forced ſurrender ſame 21ſt diſcretion ſooner accompliſhed illock peterwaradin deſerted turk illock thought fit neceſſary reduced siege belgrade formed turk think fit ſtay coming count caprara therefore firſt ſet fire town entirely abandoned alſo peterwaradin whereby imperialiſts found themſelves maſters danube far belgrade nothing fear garriſon left behind directed march conduct elector bavaria duke lorain ſick way 4th aug ſet forward salankemen came 7th within ſight part danube form iſlands zingari notwithſtanding oppoſition made turk paſſed 9th whole army artillery baggage encamped farthershoar within 4 league belgrade elector informed garriſon 15000 turk tartar city without certainty ottoman army lay near cover place elector advancing found turk abandoned camp ſet suburb lower town fire greater loſs chriſtians inſomuch latter ſecured poſts opened trench within muſquetſhot wall began work 2 battery 13th turk made greater sally much ſame succeſs next day play furiouſly cannon threw privately printed london wherein among reaſons intruſted prince orange ſuch fleet army follows king france hath upon ſeveral occaſions ſhewed himſelf diſſatisfied state gave cauſe fear apprehend caſe p 〈◊〉 meſſage king earl shrewsbury lord delamere tell king thought convenient great quiet city great safety perſon remove ham ſhall attended guard ready preſerve diſturbance given vvindſor seventeenth day december 1688 vv prince de orange guard commanded count solmes made 10 clock night could reach london king guard duty forward diſlodge twelve lord could deliver ſaid paper firſt ſent account prevent meeting prince way london come ſame day majeſty readily agreed asked whether might appoint servant ſhould attend lord replied left give order pleaſed ſo took leave gone far privychamber king ſent state horſe bonne flanders conſiſting 7 regiment elector added 3 brandenburg one commanded count flodorf neither detachment ſent camp mentz upon requeſt duke lorrain leſs conſiderable though city little gone ſurrendred detachment returned camp however army main became conſiderably leſſened herein ſo could block town yet ſo cloſely nothing could either get go mean time gariſon made ſeveral sally wherein many men killed ſides among reſt made one laſt aug ſo much fury upon dutch quarter forced vanguard broke far tent alarmed whole camp met ſame succeſs made next day upon munſterians beaten back loſs near 100 men ſlain upon ſpot 200 wounded ſtrong ſoever gariſon beginning siege bonne beſieged theſe ſeveral sally muſt need conſiderably weakned news taking mentz proclaimed elector camp diſcharge great gun could ſuppoſed add new ſtrength contrary governor heard noiſe cannon ſo ſurprized ſent know reaſon well informed could hardly believe firſt ſo ſtrong imagination town would held much longer finding true elector ſending word time capitulate began make ſome overture tho ſo unreaſonable highneſs would accept finding gen sconing returned camp reſolved undertake siege vigorouſly quit place till reduced rendred ſo much eaſie reinforcement 4000 foot 1000 horſe ſent mentz duke lorrain arriving alſo camp 25th sept wherefore approach battery haſtned diligence trench length carried foot counterſcarp breach made thing prepared ready general aſſault fallen 5th 6th oct rain fell two day together therefore sunday 9th appointed work end imperialiſts ſtorm hornwork hollander brandenburgers munſterians attackd counterſcarp halfmoon covertway purſuance hereof fell reſolved vanquiſh die attempt brandenburgers firſt lodged themſelves upon counterſcarp drave enemy ſo far breach wide enough 4 men abreaſt entred city pellmell french taken main force harder put imperialiſts ſide repulſed lodged themſelves laſtupon hornwork tho attack made without conſiderable loſs however baron de hasfield ſeeing work carried ſo much bravery fearing town would taken storm made chief buſineſs capitulate purſuance whereof hoſtages exchanged diver diſputes conteſts article agreed deputylieutenants county authorized raiſe militia caſe neceſſity roman catholicks ordered repair place abode ſtir 5 mile thence without leave held imployment state tho never ſo inconſiderable ſwear fidelity king queen thus matter brought good concluſion majeſty returning thanks prorogued 17th june haſted ireland arrived 14th ſame month preſent ſhall leave ſee nearer home rebel scotland affair scotland command colonel cannon tho otherwiſe conſiderable strength unacceſſible place poſſeſsd highland yet continued ſtill body took opportunity make frequent incurſions lowland plunder ſpoil like company bandit regular troop government however kept vigilant eye detected ſome correſpondence held perſons edenburg elſewhere pretended friend ended cloſe confinement yet notwithſtanding could jacobite scotland jacobite plot whole party would ſeem thereby diſcouraged eſpecially thoſe england thought opportune seaſon king abſent attempt ſomething conſiderable advantage cauſe therefore timely concerted matter friend ſide water ſo agreed part french fleet ſhould bear thames favour aſſiſt deſigns thoſe london numerous flocking great many conſpirators part country thither made inſurrection queen ſooner notice ſhe ſent earl torrington admiral order fight enemy whatever befel knowing could good deſign coming ſo near u diſhonourable ſoever action ſeemed engliſh nation yet one circumſtance diſtemper cheſter beginning new year ſeveral regiment broke others officer continued half pay till proviſion could made regiment whilſt others went england recruit however sickneſs degree abating fall upon belturbet taken little end conſiderable number advanced cavan follow thereupon marched diligently belturbet 700 foot 300 horſe dragoon evening towards thinking ſurprize next morning ealry 8 called dunmore officer commanded ſaw thence ill went friend belowthe late k james 〈◊〉 fra ••• e ſaid moved maſter might go help anſwer leave alone ſo marchd duleek thence great haſte dublin firſt news engliſh general killd prince orange called taken priſoner quickly undeceived lady tyrconnell got caſtle asked would supper told breakfaſt made little stomach supper next morning told citizen neceſſitated yield force ſome ſuch stuff become prey conqueror ſhould ceaſe labour deliverance long liued poſted away waterford arrived ſame day taking care bridge broken behind fear purſued went board veſſel called count de isauzun ready receive sie • r foran chief squadron meeting sea obliged go board one frigats quicker paſſage ſo got france mean time engliſh army reſted next day battel 〈…〉 refreſh themſelves 5 battalion foot 4 squadron horſe detatchd command mounſieur melonier take drogheda governour whereof received firſt summons indifferently laſt conſidering better believing iriſh army totally routed laid hold offer made garriſon marchd place baggage leaving arm behind king james ſooner left dublin proteſtants took poſſeſſion duke orm • nd king ſent thither found captain farlo • governour two day priſoner king himſelf army arrived finglaſs within 2 mile city 5th july whence went next day st patrick church returned dinner camp 2 day ſet declaration iriſh aſſuring ſuch quality protection divided army going himſelf greateſt part beyond dublin order march weſtward ſending ſame time lieutenant general douglaſs 3 regiment horſe 2 dragoon 10 foot towards athlone 50 mile n dublin ſent party march get intelligence beſides great prey cattle brought enemy quarter alſo took two spy letter athlone one adviſe one tute defend iſland nigh mullingar ſtore horſes ſeveral thing value another officer athlone father country information given earl tyrconnell duke berwick ſeveral great officer come limerick good body horſe army would 2 3 day ſo would make either hog dog ont expreſsd dauphin landed england great army french beat engliſh dutch fleet duke schomberg dead ſaid prince orange ſo king gone france great matter ſaid better without ſhews great opinion letter ſealed writ outſide juſt accout gentleman come dub • orange certainly dead ſo well mullingar douglaſs conntinued march july 17th reached athlone incamping within quarter mile town whence ſent drum ſummon old colonel grace governour fired piſtol ſent word thoſe term place ſtrong nature art athlone beſieged vain l g • uglaſs force conſiderable enterpriſe however contrived ſome battery planted 2 fieldpieces captain contarini 12 men war 2 fireſhips 29th ſame month arrived far andros underſtood admiral baſha 27 gallies 32 ship 6 galleon reſolved attack wherefore put sea 7th sept got near cape st mary ſight ottoman fleet 20 mile thence night got weathergage enemy next day 8th bore directly upon enemy part alſo endeavoured gain wind come cloſe delphino took vanguard himſelf gave rearguard contarini hardly come ſingle ship 12 turk men war becalmd whereupon turkiſh gallies fell rear captain conſtantinople algier tunis tripoli bore van ſeemed intended board chriſtians venetian gallies fired ſo thick upon contarini alſo forced fly much damnified metelin whence made ſail could focis general delphino ſeeing able overtake ſteered away morea entirely conquered venetian arm took care imaginable remainder laid deſign reconcile emperor france republick venice well intereſt pleaſe holineſs joyfully ſaid concurring holineſs pious project endeavour could never bring emperor relinquiſh alliance ſo ſolemnly entred well reſt europe security ſo project fell ground therefore recapitulate learned pen word order ſeveral remarkables leaſtthe remarkables year moſt notable happened within annual revolution preceding year ſays remarkable five conſiderable battels fought huddle every one ſomething worth particular obſervation firſt tranſilvania treachery contributed much victory valour one flanders wherein surprize great share one upon sea number got advantage one ireland fortune declared favour true merit proweſs one savoy want good intelligence ſmall experience vanquiſhed gave fortune day victor forget death elector palatine good old age princeſs portugal lingring sickneſs probability terminated ſome diſputes time might ariſen concerning succeſſion crown kingdom beginning year remarkable famous congreſs confederate held hague beſides greater number illuſtrious perſons appeard upon occaſion congreſs hague adorned preſence two elector foreign prince germany william iii king england rigour seaſon great danger tempeſtuous sea dangerous icy shoar could hinder going thither great deliverance europe ſo gloriouſly begun already ſo far carried ſome meaſure traced foregoing diſcourſe repreſented congreſs king speech congreſs imminent danger found themſelves ſufficiently diſcovered error committed ſo admonition neceſſary taking juſt better meaſures time deliberate act circumſtances enemy maſter chief fortneſſes barrier common liberty would quickly poſſeſs himſelf reſt spirit diviſion slowneſs particular intereſt continued among every one ought remain perſwaded reſpective particular intereſts comprized general one enemy force ſtrong would carry thing like torrent vain oppoſe complaint fruitleſs clamour unprofitable proteſtations againſt vnjuſtice neither reſolutions barren dyet hope ſome men fortune ariſing frivolous foundation soldier ſtrong army prompt ſincere vnion force ally muſt theſe muſt brought oppoſe without delay would put ſtop enemy conqueſts ſnatch hand liberty europe already held heavy yoke himſelf proteſted would neither ſpare credit force perſon concur ſo juſt neceſſary deſign would come spring head troop faithfully make good royal word ſo ſolemnly paſſed unto tho heartening speechthe reſolution congreſs generous reſolution king brought every one aſſembly promiſe part furniſh many troop could oppoſe enemy concur unanimouſly execution ſo noble deſign diſcourage france french king thinking way could take divert counſels taken againſt poſſible ſtrike damp confederate ſome ſignal action thro terror name arm keep back reſt europe yet engaged againſt divided army two formidable body early even march firſt advanced sea land came territory savoy reſolution beſiege nice ſhall give ſhort account come body flanders army monſieur catinat inveſted place 13th ſaid month whence ſent 3 batallions villa franca baſely ſurrendred firing one cannon killed captain caſtle ſeated upon rock environed good baſtions nice beſi • ged taken large moat ſtood yet ſo french inveſted ſide sea could carry ſimple battery raiſed great barrel faggot sack earth upon planted mortar great gun garriſon obſerving two day marchd enſigns honour diſciplined soldier ſent sea final 24th fort st auſpice alſo given without making reſiſtance upon ſame condition villa franca another fort called montalban ſame thing ſtood battery one day gave french opportuny attack nice earneſt wherein met greater facility expected 26th conſuls city ſent deputy catinat agreed certain hour upon certain signal receive french king men city without governours privity notice attempted make himſelf maſter one gate prevent deſign citizen reſolved ſecure houſes ravage bomb taken meaſures got arm fired upon governours detatchments given ſignal french entred took poſſeſſion city midnight promiſed deputy city ſhould enjoy privilege immunity formerly governour caſtle finding thing went endeavoured fire citymagazine failed threatned ſhot againſt city garriſon ſhould quarter deter plaid 27th day upon chief governours houſe one convent french made 3 attack upon caſtle carried great vigour notwithſtanding badneſs way 30th one magazine ſet fire magazine powder therein ſpread ſelf moment caſtle blew good part killed 600 garriſon 50 beſiegers trench piece stone timber powder carried thither governour ſad diſaſter french made themſelves maſters covered way ſecond incloſure thought high time capitulate 2d april got honourable term french conceive savoy enough therefore give confederate convincing proof readineſs anſwer attack moſt ſenſible part inveſted ſtrong city mon ſiege mon 15th march place french king notwithſtanding diſſwaſions ſaid madam de maintenon contrary arrived 21ſt perſon took round town accompanied dauphin duke orleans duke de chartres whereupon next day trench begun draining moraſs trench begun divert courſe troville force run ſide 26th trench advanced within 150 pace ſide ſame day mill hion attackd redoubt covered double repulſe carried french main force conſiderable loſs ſide thing end french raiſed large battery leaſt 25 mortar playd one inceſſantly made terrible havock town notwithſtanding ſtout reſiſtance beſieged french advanced ſo far 1ſt apr year 1691 able fill moat hornwork attack began 3 afternoon loſs great many men began lodgement thereupon almoſt half done beſieged headed ſome ſtouteſt officer attempted beat effect conſtrained granadeers guard give way yet laſt beſiegers loſs 200 men regained poſt puſhd siege great vigour rather becauſe heard king england come vilvord confederate army intention force came attempt relieve mon though indeed little likelihood thing ſo unprovided ſo much neceſſary carriage ready expedition neglect laid charge marqueſs de caſtinaga governour spaniſh netherlands beſiegers 8th apr probably could ſeveral day longer made ſuch progreſs siege neceſſitated garriſon capitulate tho laſt beat parley day truth whole matter could well otherwiſe firſt monk eccleſiaſticks known friend france inſtigation burgher town importunate governour capitulate upon refuſal threatned open gate enemy deliver garriſon beſiegers hand mon ſurrendred ſo ſhort notwithſtanding colonel fagels effort contrary perſwading citizen quiet would capitulate muſt purſuance agreement garriſon marchd 10th apr left french intire poſſeſſion important fortreſs confederate look conſider would terminate preſent ſhall leave tell king william hereupon repaſſing sea gave neceſſary order imaginable thing ready intire reduction ireland left management lieutenant general ginkle majeſty himſelf return flanders head confederate army try iſſue campaign whether would carried ended ſide began reſolved preſent proſecute iriſh war even final event army country gone winterquartersthe war ireland already related preceding year remained either ſide pretty quiet 〈◊〉 time tho ſeveral deſigns brewing party againſt hapned nothing great moment moſt conſiderable miſchief done engliſh wicked rapperies country native iriſh arm firſt laſt ſufficiently quit yet ſuch forwardneſs either take field month june came firſt baltymore ſurrendred engliſh initiating work engliſh proved siege baltymore ſurrendred 9th ſaid month whence ſome day ſtay army marchd towards athlone 19th early morning vanguard marched ballyburn beat enemy ſeveral outditches within wall engliſh town athlone ſide shannon lodged themſelves ſaid ditch next day battery raiſed council war held wherein reſolved ſtorm engliſh town iriſh pretended defend done accordingly tho iriſh made conſiderable reſiſtancethe engliſh town athlone taken yet engliſh went kept firing till got breach made french lieutenant firſt mounted throwing granado firing piece ordering men ſame great bravery incouraged party tho loſt life action ſo town taken abundance enemy killed drowned endeavouring eſcape battery planted againſt iriſh town 22d morning finiſhed cannon mortar began play briskly n e ſide caſtle weakeſt continued ſo next day tinboats came priſoner taken gave account 64 men mill upon bridge fired engliſh granadoes thoſe within able quench get thence burnt death except priſoner one leaped water 24th ſpent raiſing battery one another bridge 3d erected without townwall riverſide oppoſite baſtion iriſh made ſide river ſame time contriving method paſs river iriſh idle raiſing battery making neceſſary preparation defence heighten courage engliſh 26th fired 7 battery upon enemy work great execution deſign paſſing shannon ford towards laneſborough fruſtrate general reſolved try could forcing way athlone therefore laboured hard gain bridge found difficult work however 27th evening engliſh burnt breaſtwork iriſh made ſide broken arch throwing granadoes made wood preſently ſet fire next morning 28th engliſh laid beam partly planked party enemy attempting ruine every man ſlain diſcourage another party 10 men ſet ſame work bravely effected throwing plank beam maugre firing skill engliſh alſo periſhed except 2 made general reſolve carry work cloſe gallery bridge deſigned paſs shannon next day met ſuch oppoſition eſpecially gallery burnt iriſh proſecution attack deferred day 29th 30th council war held ſtifly debated whether adviſeable make another attempt draw though appeared great reaſons latter yet duke wirtemburg majorgenerals mackay talmaſh ruvigny teautau urged brave action could attempted without hazzard attempt probable profered themſelves firſt ſhould attempt force enemy work perſons particularly talmaſh happily performed accordingly detatchment drawn day ordered ſtill readineſs general gave command ſhould brought 6 uſual time relieving guard enemy might ſuſpect deſign indeed information given general 2 officer morning deſerted enemy thing ready conjuncture favourable signal giventhe engliſh paſs shannon captain sandys two lieutenant lead firſt party 60 granadiers armour 20 abreſt ſeconded another good body amazing reſolution took ford little left bridge againſt baſtion enemy stream thereof rapid deep time alſo engliſh great ſmall shot began play battery work upon thoſe iriſh ſide fired thick poſſibly could upon men paſſing river yet gallantly forced theirway fire smoak gained bank reſt laid plank broken part bridge others laying bridge boat whereby engliſh paſſed ſo faſt leſs half hour maſters town trench beſides one beyond town iriſh amazed ſuddenneſs thing reſolution engliſh quickly gave ground retired towards camp tho great many killed worksthe iriſh town athlone taken yet obſervable engliſh ſaw themſelves really maſters place forward kill thoſe mercy tho manner heat action rubbiſh stuff beaten cannon difficult climb great part enemy work made soldier curſe ſwear even among bullet gave occaſion brave man right army french auxiliary upon news ſaid impoſſible engliſh pretend take town ſo near army ſuccour ſoon aſſured engliſh actual poſſeſſion place greatly lamented misfortune ordered ſeveral detachment beat ſenſible former overſight demoliſhing thoſe fortification athlone next camp engliſh poſſeſsd work entirely againſt themſelves adviſeable way decamp army night whoſe motion reſolution general ginkle various report however continued athlone till 10th july finding town pretty well cleared work raiſed neceſſary defence marchd army next day 11th reachd balſhanoe encamping along river suck upon roſcommonſide good paſs iriſh might given great deal trouble gaining found better place appear poſture lay ſide aghrimcaſtle three mile beyond balſhanoe extended church kilcommodon right place called half mile diſtance bogg cut great many ſmall incloſures iriſh managed ſo made communication one another lined thoſe thick ſmall shot word enemy ſo poſted could poſſibly better general ginkle upon wherein engliſh valour exerted greateſt degree glory imaginable sunday 12th july come engliſh army commanded advance upon enemy morning proving foggy moved till 12 clock done good order ground would admit general ſame time going party view enemy perceiving ſome scout upon hill ordered party beat enemy retiring within half mile camp gave general opportunity high hill right enemy view whole army eppingers dragoon get thoſe body camp diſcovered enemy advantage pouring ſo many men upon engliſh would ſtill hard dragoon ſeconded earl portland horſe behaved themſelves great bravery tho without opportunity engage otherwiſe impoſſible advice deſired end half hour 4 afternoon party engliſh left wing moved towards enemy 5 battle began afreſh ditch ſtrongly guarded iriſh muſketeers horſe advantageouſly poſted ſuſtain iriſh behaved themſelves like men another nation defending poſts great obſtinacy would ſtir one ſide till engliſh put piece line communication one ditch another would preſently poſt themſelves flank engliſh occaſiond great firing ſides continued left almoſt hour half right wing army center bega • engage except cannon playd ſides mean time engliſh army advanced good march 〈◊〉 enemy loweſt hedge beat iriſh thence however retreat far poſted themſelves • next ditch engliſh ſeeing diſdaining ſuffer lodging ſo near beat thenc • alſo ſo hedge hedge till got near main body iriſh ſo well orderd th • matter made eaſie paſſage horſe among thoſe hedge ditch mean poured great number horſe foot upon engliſh colonel earl obſerving encouraged men advancing ſaying way come brave yet flanked fronted beſides expoſed enemy shot adjacent ditch engliſh forced quit ground retire bog loſs great many men among others brave colonel earl herbert former twice taking retaking got free laſt tho without wounded latter ſaid barbarouſly murthered quarter given iriſh ſaw alſo like reſcued colonel st john colonel tiffin lord george hambleton french engliſh service ſeveral regiment marching upon bog iriſh lay ſo cloſe ditch ſeveral doubtful whether men place ſooner french reſt got within 20 yard ditch iriſh fired moſt furiouſly upon ſuſtained intrepidy ſtill preſſed forward tho could ſcarce ſee one another smoak battle ſeemed ſo doubtful ſome time byſtander would rather given iriſh ſide driven engliſh foot center ſo far back almoſt got line great gun planted near bog engliſh benefit conjuncture becauſe mixture iriſh men hear little horſe tell majorgeneral ruvignis regiment french sir john laniers poſted right afterwards part drawn left good service right wing engliſh horſe mean time making beſt way ſuccour foot ſaw danger indeed hazard becauſe difficulty paſs preſſing tumbling dangerous place among shower bullet body enemy dragoon foot poſted conveniently covertplace iriſh obſtruct others paſſage however horſe bravely ſurmounting theſe difficulty lodged themſelves laſt dry ditch throng enemy shot aghrim caſtle ſome old wall hedge adjoyning reported st ruth ſeeing engliſh horſe draw way beginning ſcramble place two could go breaſt without great difficulty aſked meant anſwered would certainly endeavour paſs attack left ſaid reply oath brave fellow pity ſhould ſo expoſed however horſe made good paſs lord oxford ruvignis langſtons bierlys regiment together leviſons dragoon repulſed beat enemy ſeveral time making party good ſide tho without loſs engliſh foot laboured great diſadvantage center obſerved brave majorgeneral talmaſh haſted relief ſome freſh men gave order broken regiment halt face immediately bravely charged iriſh advanced upon center bog killed 300 could retreat marched boldly old ground whence lately beaten majorgeneral mackay ſame time fallen upon enemy good body horſe left majorgeneral ruvigni went along ſide bog another party horſe great service bore horſe foot engliſh right iriſh left mixed nothing continued fire hot diſpute along line iriſh could defend ditch engliſh beat thence thing doubtful much longer tho monſieur st ruth ſaw engliſh foot center repulſed great extacy told would beat engliſh army gate dublin yet ſeeing horſe preſs towards caſtle ordered brigade horſe march riding one battery giving order gunner fire marching toward place ſaw engliſh endeavour go killed great shot one battery rid hill kilcomodon place main ſtreſs battle fought juſt iriſh camp general fell one retinue threw cloak corp ſoon removed behind hill guard going ſame time iriſh horſe perceiving great many drew alſo ſhort time army driven top killcomodon hill camp laid levelled expoſed engliſh shot openly began run downright foot towards great bog behind left horſe high way towards loughreah action right wing center army thoſe towards left firſt engaged kept ground little hapned ſide near 2 hour neither daniſh horſe foot left diſturb enemy yet ſtood oppoſite ſeveral body horſe foot faced ſide ſmall brook perceiving mackays battalion drive enemy leaſt theſe body faced ſhould fall back relief flying party engaged half hour hot work iriſh upon decline fled field foot miſerably ſlaugterd engliſh horſe dragoon horſe purſued nigh 3 mile yet night coming thick miſty rain prevented engliſh getting advantageous paſs near loughreagh gave many opportunity eſcape however computed leſs 7000 ſlain upon spot engliſh 600 soldier killed beſides 73 officer 960 wounded number add officer amount near 1100 ſtill make battle conſiderable ſince engliſh army make 17000 horſe foot iriſh 20000 foot 5000 horſe dragoon engliſh army lay upon arm night taking ſome day refreſhment general received diver information concerning state galloway moſt conſiderable place left hand iriſh next limerick reſolved direct march thither poſted troop ſent trumpet ſummon garriſon anſwered lord dillon governour monſieur vſſone commanded chief ſame opinion himſelf reſt officer reſolved defend place laſt reſolution engliſh paſſed part army river taken fort iriſh building beat parley hoſtages exchanged iriſh demurring upon manner surrendry made general impatient ſent twice haſten reſolutions laſt lieutenant colonel burk one hoſtages permitted go majorgeneral talmaſh believed inclined lay treaty aſide deſired ready begin give engliſh ſign firing gun air replied would fire within till provoked without galloway ſurrendered ſo ſome time article agreed town ſurrendred 20th july hand engliſh conſequence whereof submiſſion baldarick donnel conſiderable number men command ſome time marching engliſh army towards limerick full intention conqueſt place compleat ireland limerick beſieged arrived 25th aug lord tyrconnell died ſome day ſame day poſſeſsd themſelves iretons cromwels fort ordered called mackays naſſaus becauſe gained thoſe commander two day caſtleconnell another called carruk gunnel ſtanding upon river 3 mile town attacked detachment army garriſons made priſoners war ſame time engliſh ship came river fired ſome shot iriſh horſe camp near river put iriſh countenance till made believe either engliſh ship elſe thoſe would quickly ſwallowed french fleet hourly expected tho siege carried great vigour interi • iriſh quitted ſeveral ſmall place daily country brigadier leviſon routed ſeveral party county kerry cannon bomb great execution upon camp within town yet 17th sept hotly diſputed council war whether ſhould go siege march river deſtroy enemy forage county clare make blockade ſo far carried latter engineer ordered go guard towards kilmalock fortifie place got camp countermanded great many paliſados brought mackays fort army intended winter 19th reſolved paſs river party either proſecute siege leaſt burn forage ſame day battery raiſed iretons fort old church flank iriſh caſe sally st john gate four mortar brought great battery mackays fort place judged fitteſt bombarding ſince whole town lay line thence order given caſe allarm iriſh troop without every regiment ſhould ſtand poſts aſſignd end iriſh declined hazzard thing 20th moſt heavy cannon drawn ſent shipboard remember well upon news england moſt intelligent perſons opinion town would taken year tho news sligos ſurrendred earl granard came confirmed ſame time general indefatigable buſineſs 22d marchd moſt horſe dragoous bridge boat laid county clare leaving mackay talmaſh command ſide morning enemy continually fired upon ſeveral battery without great harm afternoon party colonel matthew dragoon attackd ſtronger party enemy till ſuſtained greater force continued ſome ſmall firing till 4 clock foot came made iriſh retire till got cannon engliſh granadiers ſuſtained 4 regiment foot commanded advance attack work covered thumondbridge one fort right musketſhot bridge another left ſomewhat nearer beſides ſeveral natural fortification wherein enemy poſted detachment 200 men engliſh hot diſpute firſt cannon playing king caſtle 2 3 battery alſo ſmall shot wall made attack ſeem hazardous engliſh ordered approach ſo nigh town however iriſh preſſed upon granadiers quitted firſt poſts reinforced another detachment town could buſineſs engliſh granadiers ſo forward deſpiſed danger degree put whole body flight purſued ſo cloſe french major commanded thumondgate fearing engliſh would enter town ordered drawbridge plucked left whole party mercy engliſh ſhewed little either killed taken except 120 got town bridge drawn alſo many drowned hereupon engliſh lodged themſelves within 10 yard bridge notwithſtanding high tower ſtood near end bridge next iriſh finding communication cut horſe deſpairing french succour began think giving town whereof engliſh general great hope however puſhd siege next day 23d sept much • ury notwithſtanding proved rainy yet gun mortar ceaſed play upon town enemy fire furiouſly done ſome time towards night rain began ceaſe storm ended together 6 enemy beat parley ſides town next day morning lieutenantgeneral sarsfield majorgeneral waughup came general deſired ceſſation arm might continued 3 day till could ſend horſe encamped towards clare order included general capitulation propoſed agreed thereupon priſoners town releaſed 29th sarsfield waughup dined general agreed hoſtages ſhould exchanged order treaty done accordingly next day iriſh ſent propoſals ſuch extravagant term general ſo far granting returned anſwer tho stranger law england yet underſtood thoſe thing inſiſted upon ſo far contradictory ſo diſhonourable himſelf could grant ſuch thing thereupon ordered new battery immediately raiſed upon requeſt iriſh ſent 12 article proved sum capitulation sarsfield others came 29th general long debate agreed upon article surrender limerick fort caſtles kingdom poſſeſſion iriſh ſigned oct 3d party conſiſted two part civil military firſt ſigned lord juſtices general latter part general follow romancatholicks kingdom ſhall enjoy ſuch privilege exerciſe religion conſiſtent law ireland enjoy reign king charles ii majeſties ſoon affair permit summon parliament kingdom endeavour procure ſaid romancatholicks ſuch farther security particular may preſerve diſturbance upon account ſaid religion ii inhabitant reſidents limerick garriſon poſſeſſion iriſh officer soldier arm commiſſion king james thoſe authorized grant ſame ſeveral county limerick clare kerry cork mayo commiſſioned officer majeſties quarter belong iriſh regiment treated priſoners war taken protection ſhall return ſubmit majeſties obedience every heir ſhall hold poſſeſs enjoy every eſtates freehold inheritance right title intereſt privilege immunity every held enjoyed rightfully lawfully intituled reign k charles ii time ſince law statute force ſaid reign k charles ii ſhall put poſſeſſion order government ſuch king hand hand tenant without put suit trouble therein ſuch eſtates ſhall freed diſchargd arrears crownrents quitrents publick charge incurred become due ſince michaelmas 1688 day date hereof perſons comprehended article ſhall hold enjoy good chattles real perſonal belonging remaining either hand hand perſon perſons whatſoever truſt uſe every ſaid perſons trade profeſſion calling ſoever ſhall may uſe exerciſe practiſe ſeveral reſpective profeſſions trade calling freely uſe exerciſe enjoy ſame reign k james ii provided nothing article contained conſtrued extend reſtore forfeiting perſon kingdom except hereafter comprized provided alſo perſon whatſoever ſhall enjoy benefit article ſhall neglect refuſe take oath allegiance made act parliament england firſt year reign preſent majeſties thereunto required iii merchant reputed merchant city limerick garriſon poſſeſſed iriſh town place county clare kerry abſent beyond sea born arm retaken given account french poſſeſt themſelves place mention article upon given performed fidelity ought french took vaudois garriſon cannon arm baggage threatned detain priſoners give demanded without reſiſtance reſolved revenged upon therefore waylaid french upon road aſſailed extraordinary courage taking away arm good part baggage german obſerving thought much better alſo looking ſo compleatly gleaned poor french vaudois left tho monſieur catinat made heavy complaint yet anſwer given truly ſorry ſhould ſo happen himſelf ſet firſt example however future would take care prevent reduction fortr • ſs montmelian whether monſieur catinat ordered repair take command army upon arrived place 16th nov moſt vigorous siege wherein conflict well rigour seaſon montmelian fortreſs ſurrendred deſperate defence garriſon laſt ſurrendred upon 22d dec upon honourable term became entire maſters dutchy savoy french king careſſing state italy embaſſador count rebenac fear apprehenſions danger might becauſe ſucceſs arm might move cloſe confederate thereby encreaſe number enemy ſtood might prove many ti time u leave italy ſee hungary 2 laſt year different succeſs two contending party perhaps ever known turk doubt big expectation poſſibly hope regain loſſes another campaign made great preparation neither emperor part backward therein engaging prince baden command army pretty late summer joined ſame near peterwaradin whence decamped reſolution march towards enemy lay semlin ſide save whoſe cavalry 10th aug ſhewed themſelves morning drawn line little imperial army amuſement intention fight tho prince came near turkiſh camp 12th could provoke would ſtir think adviſeable attack ſince invironed broad deep moat defended good redoubt 150 piece cannon mounted upon battery therefore retreated little tempt come forth ſo much rather becauſe forced go far salankemen proviſions ſent army could come water becauſe turk numerous saicks upon river place chriſtians effect prince miſtaken conception turk thinking chriſtians fled ſent ſome troop fall upon rear army marchd ſtill continued motion 17th tho ſo miſty could hardly diſcern one another ſoon cleared heard turkiſh drum found whole army marching towards yet becauſe winding danube hindered ſight enemy part flank chriſtians made motion ſecure saicks lay salankemen purpoſe front tho army poſted well yet upon 18th order given retire advantageous poſt poſſeſs riſing ground salankemen time day diſcovered upon right hand conſiderable body turk marching order battle upon right road peterwaradin deſign prevent chriſtians making themſelves maſters firſt hillock near salankemen veſſels saicks ſame time near unto thoſe chriſtians deſign ſeize 3 4000 horſe engaged left wing along danube skirmiſhing day ſtill retiring chriſtians made ſhew reſiſtance buquos regiment dragoon mean time detachd convoy 200 wagon came peterwaradin ſurrounded conſiderable body enemy long reſiſtance almoſt cut piece made priſoners poſſeſt chriſtians work fortifie cut chriſtians communication peterwaradin prince baden ſaw plainly deſperate game play muſt either force turk entrenchment periſh station proviſions place whereupon former reſolved next day 19th aug time thing ordered following manner duke chriſtian holſtein part right wing next danube regiment neuburg make himſelf maſter riſing ground ſeparated imperial army enemy mean open way body army theſe ſeconded 20 battalion command general souches campmareſchal staremburg army followed order battle order extend ſelf much poſſible danube plain left wing order march campaign 1691 diſappointed ſtill went deſign granvale employed write du mont retird hanover encourage ſecond attempt preſent campaign soon granvale diſcoverd deſigns one leefdale paris ſeemd willingly duckets bruſſels bill exchange john amour deposd granvale told bruſſels great buſineſs asked whether thing ſay king england replied break neck warnd difficulty attempt anſwerd given word marqueſs acquainted monſieur bedal king france miniſter hanover told would good buſineſs could done lent 50 crown encouragement granvale laſt examined finding buſineſs diſcovered letter ready produced againſt confeſſed circumſtances deſign upon granvale carried army put upon tryal upon evidence appeared ſo clear granvale himſelf confeſsd ſo much without naming rack judge met ſeveral time laſt gave sentence whereas bartholomew de liniere sieur de granvale native picardy confeſſed court martial without conſtraint farther appeareth marqueſs louvois late secretary king france agreed du mont murder king william upon ſaid du mont preſented marqueſs draught manner might done upon death louvois son secretary alſo french king marqueſs barbeſieux revived ſaid conſpiracy du mont paid 30 piſtols father orderd lifetime priſoner came acquainted du mont monſieur rebenacs houſe monſieur paparel ſaying du mont would fit perſon carry king du mont replied execration would carry king alive dead promiſed louvois du mont delivered ſame another project barbeſieux priſoner prompt deſign ſeveral conference barbeſieux paparel told ſhould inform du mont king great britain wore coat mail acquainted du mont du mont replyd twas matter would kill priſoner engaged one parker colonel late king james execute ſame deſign ſaid parker told laid ſame deſign marqueſs louvois priſoner ſaid barbeſieux paparel parker ſomewhat exaggerate loſs french computing 18000 yet ſurely luxemburg purſuing upon retreat continuing 15 day together waren without making leaſt attempt gave conſiderable reputation ſaid cannon mortar confederate muſt content loſt greateſt part however french give ſome reputation aſſertions ſaid relation battel laſt reſolve beſiege charleroy inveſted 31ſt aug reinforced troop seacoaſt great relief yet gallantly held till 1ſt oct made honourable capitulation truth place made brave defence flanders ſince war afforded suſpition treachery surrender tho charleroy garriſon spaniard loſt flanders ſo late year charleroy beſieged ſurrendred french ſaving themſelves ſo far able ally conjunction able effect yet better provided catalonia french ſo early 29th may inveſted roſes sea land prevented vain talk faſhion ſo leave ſee done germany german ſo ſlow french ſo forward latter paſſed rhine phillipsburg without oppoſition 18th may marqueſs de chamilli 2000 men inveſted heidleburg heidelburg taken deſtroyed french long threatned duke de lorge croſſed firſt mountain 30000 men oppoſe prince baden year commanded upon rhine yet condition act defenſively hardly ſo poor heidelburg ſhift ſelf god know done ſorrily beſides weakneſs otherwiſe ſuch diviſion soldier townſmen money called would go current 19th regiment sconbeck ready enter town reinforce garriſon townſmen ſo incenſed againſt soldier oppoſed entrance gave melac opportunity ſeize redoubt whence could batter backpart work town ſhort french 21ſt entred subburbs little oppoſition granadiers drave beſieged ſo much haſte caſtle gate left 600 soldier without put sword governour caſtle fearing ſame deſtiny ſent capuchin propoſals de lorge ſo far admitting prepared aſſault governour finding accepted offer made french 2d garriſon number 1200 men 2 piece cannon 12 waggon laden baggage conducted wimpel burning city caſtle heidleburg french barbarity committed pala • inate let others relate stomach fluſhd succeſs de lorge advanced towards neckar deſign attack prince baden encamped ſide river french laid 2 bridge order paſs ſo warmly received german afterwards wimpſen attempted ſame thing forced quit enterprize come loſs near 1000 men time thisthe dauphine inclined attack prince baden dauphine joined army near 70000 ſtrong finding paſs zwingenberg would great advantage took ſaid caſtle storm routed ſome party without hot diſpute within ſmall garriſon yet found way eſcape petty succeſſes greatly outnumbring prince baden men made dauphine deſirous attack camp near flein wherefore tho knew advantageouſly intrenched yet 26th july croſſed neckar advanced within 4 hour march prince thereupon recalled detachment ſtrengthen himſelf ſo much ſince certain advice 31ſt dauphine reſolved give de grace bomb • rd • engliſh lord berkley • 12th july brought fleet near poſſible ſent 6 ment war 9 bomb galliots away take station day night till 4 next morning threw city 1100 bomb carcaſſe • ſet houſes fire ſeveral place ſo townſmen knowing whither run deſpairing quench took fright began run away diſorder made marqueſs bearon ſend 2 battalion militia bretaign encourage inhabitant diſorders ſo fleet allarming coaſt ſailed towards havre de grace 26th 3 afternoon bega • approach town direction captain bemb • 4 5 began throw bomb continued till next morning wind blowing hard gave ſhooting tho havre de grace entirely ruined de • p yet great part burnt ſo conſiderable damage done place ſoon repaired french thus put coaſtthe confederate french motion towards flanders army little ſtreightned confederate netherlands though dauphine declared received order father budge camp vignamont long confederate continued mont st andre yet able poſſibly ſubſiſt longer reſolved decamp firſt though thought concealed deſign ſending forth ſeveral little body horſe pretence forraging reinforce marqueſs harcourts body ſide meuſe ſeize advantageous poſt picton mean get confederate yet king aware deſign decamped 8th aug ſoon gained poſts picton forrage 4 day informed enemy march moved towards neville thence leſſines ſent order baking bread ghent aeth 12th army poſted ſelf chieere whence evening numerous detachment horſe foot ſome piece cannon went poſſeſs themſelves poſt upon scheld army followed 14th intention paſſed river pont eſpeires tho confederate made great haſte get thither french made prevent 15th elector bavaria advanced towards pont de eſchaie •• e numerous detachment order attack paſſage river found french number 30000 men entrenched ſide teeth ſo think convenient proceed haſty march french coſt men horſes willing loſt ſome battle however muſt ſaid buſineſs worth hinder confederate enter french flanders done ſo would probability together ſome important conqueſt ſecured ſome winter quarter leaſt beſides loſſes would almoſt inevitably followed french king ſo ſenſible writ letter order reading head armythe french king letter army wherein returned thanks firſt inveſted ſides meuſe town ſurrendred confederate 19th sept battery raiſed againſt caſtle artillery conſiſted 60 piece cannon 30 mortar came french made sally upon majorgeneral cohorns quarter hope taken 3 fieldpieces repulſed loſs ſo work went briskly till 21ſt night beſieged opened trench theſe carried great vigour till 24th morning brandenburg underofficer regiment anhault mounted counterſcarp fort piccard head 15 soldier ſo much courage bravery killed french threw tunful granadoes water took away barrel powder ſome arm brought camp ſight duke holſtein ploen general ſo ſatisfied bravery brandenburg general immediately wrote elector deſire beſtow captain place upon young officer beſiegers ſame day continued firing upon caſtle two fort laſt taken 700 brandenburghers dint sword heat fury put 150 french death gave quarter 70 others moſtly wounded loſs 20 men fluſhd succeſs puſhed siege caſtle wonderful vigour wherein made conſiderable breach thing ready aſſault gallant retreat prince informed montals motion finding already paſſed thielt wiſely changed reſolution fighting though time urgent preſſing immediately moſt admirable judgment reſolved upon contrived retreat perſon great foreſight wiſely provided ſuch accident morning ordering baggage load immediately march way deinſe ghent might embarraſs motion army firſt prince ordered cannon drawn battery contrived prince right left army diſappeared juſt vaniſhed enemy ſight prince duke wirtemberg general kept retrenchment till marched forming domeſticks attendant little body horſe ſtill impoſe upon french followed army ſoon got enemy finding themſelves thus ſo ſtrangely amuſed could overtake confederate fall upon rear particularly montal endeavoured attack body commanded lord overkirke overtook ſome squadron horſe dragoon defile good brigadeer collier ordered grenadier brigade rear face enemy time time advanced defile ſo well contrived grenadier fire kept french diſtance made good retreat attempted ſame thing upon rear body foot commanded count de noyelles like ill succeſs however two squadron dragoon putting green bow hat confederate signal battle ſpeaking ſome french ſome engliſh garriſon way repriſal king expreſſed ſo much value perſon looked upon ſufficient caution anſwer 6000 men number two garriſons dixmude deynſe ſame time offered liberty majeſtys order would paſs word conſpirators execute longdeſigned attempt againſt majeſtys perſon propoſed seizing majeſty carrying alive france purpoſe pretended caſtle seaſide ſecured detain king till ship ready tranſport thither impracticable murthering king came saturday st james chappel purpoſe 40 men well armed aſſault majeſtys guard commonly exceed 25 6 men foot ſhould ſhut hydepark gate reſt aſſaſſinate majeſty agreed wherein gate ſhut hinders coach horſes paſſing way one aſſaſſins ſent view ground another view lane beforementioned sir george barclay command infamous party approve lane difficulty aroſe debate cauſed project rejected laſt fixed upon place betwixt brentford turnhamgreen bottom ground mooriſh bridge diver road meet cr • ſs oen another north ſide road go round brentford south lane lead river ſo one may come thither four ſeveral way paſſed bridge road grows narrow one ſide footpath tall thick hedge place pitched upon execution barbarous villany truly heaven diſcovered treaſons burnt ſpoiled beſides church convent ſome part cazern however fleet much better succeſs attempt upon iſle 〈◊〉 arrived 14th july command lord berkeley men war came anchor galliots advanced within three quarter mile st martin ſaid iſland nine clock night began bombard ſet town fire five ſeveral place three french made ſhift quench two continued burn great violence three next morning till ſame hour afternoon forbore bombing time tide ſerving began work continued till four next morning whereby town ſet fire ſeveral place greateſt part conſumed deſtroyed alſo ship road beſides feluca laden salt brandy took coming away french manner ſurprized attempt ſo dexterous working bombardeers greater executice done upon town attempted ſince burning diepe tho could ſucceed ſo well upon olonne next attempted miſtake situation place yet conſiderable damage done alſo theſe thing bombgalliots light frigats lord berkeky landed iſle groa near port louis two others near bell iſle soldier deſtroyed 20 village burnt 1300 houſes brought away booty 1600 head cattle beſides fleet took 20 bark veſſel newfoundland retook one weſtindia ship together ſmall frigat privateer st malos taken ſo ended summer expedition tho perhaps ſomewhat exaggerated part yet certainly damage muſt great flouriſhes world could make appear otherwiſe ſpent ſome time manner give account proceeding fleet againſt thoſe port france look towards spain ſhall ſee firſt done enter upon occurrence yearthe fight french spaniard 〈◊〉 cata • onia army pretty early field ſide spaniard ſtill content defenſive perhaps would fully ſatisfied lain unmoleſted camp near oſtalrick french willing ſhould ſo therefore duke de vendoſme paſſed ter underſtanding spaniſh cavalry encamped within line advanced obſerve reſolved attack firſt done firſt day june spaniard finding none horſe appear againſt beginning ſtoutly ſtood ground forced ſome french squadron recoil ſaw number increaſe good party infantry come ſupport spaniard thought beſt way retire within line good order making retreating fight till got reach cannon french greedy purſuit illy entertained artillery forced retire conſiderable loſs tho spaniard loſt near 300 men yet loſs french greater would mean agree tho ſeem well ſatisfied action ſelf know nothing elſe moment happend way reſt campaignthe campaign germany therefore croſs country obſerve ſide rhine nothing campaigne th • beginning misfortune receive dangerou • wound forced leave battle whi •• died party thus contending ſide th • enemy cavalry poured upon ſome imperial regiment firſt put rout broke upon second line ſtopped ſhort infantry till firſt line cloſed ſome regiment horſe ſent ſide upon ſame regiment vigorouſly repreſſed enemy hindred ſaid purſuing ſome unknown order however ſome regiment horſe purſued extraordinary courage even barricade upon ſome foot immediately detached away ſupply place regiment horſe left void firſt line ſecond endeavour together force enemy waggonbarricades janiſaries fired ſo furiouſly upon imperialiſts obliged retire purſued turk retreat ſo haſty another regiment horſe quite put order regiment capraras coming ſeaſonably relief charged enemy flank drove back barricade ſo much loſs confuſion grand seignior commanded reſerve 3000 men perſon little diſtance behind barricade much adoe ſtop runaway prevent troop forſaking ſaid barricade night coming thought convenient attack barricade however elector kept army upon field battle arm night offered sultan battle next day declined ſo ended battle one fought reſolution bravery ſides age ſeemed like maina formerly leuctra epinanondas conquered lacedemonians ſaid deſcended ancient king sparta long detained priſon conſtantinople afterwards releaſed sultan hope would recovered morea venetian reaſon honoured ſeveral title dignity married widow hoſpodar moldavia gave large extent country certain little contributed ſtop progreſs venetian arm however brought conducted corinth venetian general received according merit preſented croſs ſet diamond dalmatia republick thought extended dominion way reducing dulcigno dulcigno beſieged venetian inveſted force 12th auguſt tho general delphino carried work great application routed 5000 turk came relieve conſequences taking town yet caſtle made vigorous defence gave baſha scutari opportunity attempt relief ſecond time purpoſe fell upon wing venetian much fury repulſed leſs vigour morlakes purſued great slaughter loſs 12 colour notwithſtanding double rout turk effort venetian reduce caſtle forced give enterprizethe se • ge raiſed content themſelves lay country waſte round many mile deſtroy 60000 olive tree brought great revenue enemy yet valued themſelves much upon fleet beating turk mezzomorto tho according relation themſelves given ſeem proportionably conſiderable fight briefly thus general molino ſetting sail gulph eugenia upon laſt july gallies galleaſſes ſent away men war andros order make intended land mean try whether could draw turkiſh fleet engagement received intelligence mezzomorto turkiſh admiral appeared near caſtella reſto • e venetian beat • e tu • k • far negropont 36 men war two fire ſhips 46 galliots long bark whereupon venetian general upon 9th auguſt quitted gulph eugenia gallies galleaſſes order joyn men war meet enemy conjunction thro badneſs weather could till 21ſt time general calling council war reſolved fall upon enemy purpoſe tow men war gallies becauſe calm becauſe turk cauſed men war towed like manner galliots long bark towards golden cape 19 clock according italian way reckoning vanguard venetian fleet conſiſting 8 men war could come however tho advantage keeping fleet cloſe upon line whereas body venetian fleet could get becauſe calm molino engaged left wing turkiſh fleet whilſt 8 abovementioned veſſels galleaſſes fell upon right extraordinary vigour bravery fight continued till dark turkiſh line broke fleet began bear away sail could make got next day port scio ſtaid two day longer refit three ship ſo battered forced take gun three galliots sultana loſt fight 600 men killed beſides ſeveral wounded venetian loſt never veſſel men thence general molino ſailed back andros word met enemy guard near zenta hereupon huſſars immediately ſent away ſuccour bring performed order took baſſa priſoner returned without loſs one man baſſa examined threatned head cut off▪ tell truth underſtanding imperialiſts decamped peter waradin followed cloſe heel numerous garriſon segedin ſtopt zenta laid bridge theyſſe brought waggon built belgrade laſt winter direction frenchman neat good commodious invention grand seignior deſign march tranſilvania vpper hungary purpoſe already paſſed theyſſe perſon ſome thouſands horſe laſt night baſſa ſent upon scout artillery heavy baggage began paſs ſame river reſt army ſtill ſide hundred piece cannon could tell whether thoſe troop would paſs river mean time turk already intre • ched begun caſt another intrenchment head bridge baſſa added tartar coruſſes ſome turk burnt country though ſaid received ſuch order sultan eaſie believed upon information army continued march receiving advice every moment huſſars spy enemy ſtill croſſing river cavalry ſtirred intrenchment according cuſtom skirmiſh chriſtians two hour priſoners gave account greateſt part horſe already ſide river reſt haſting paſs imperialiſts could imagine infantry could ſtay alone ſide river becauſe night done begun make ſecond retrenchment according report baſſa priſoners obliged prince eugenius advance cavalry ſome artillery within hour march zenta receiving diver confirmation march reported prince come place beforementioned ſtaid foot arrived drew army battlearray right wing ſecured theyſſe battle zenta left extended far men could take ground left flank reinforced second line order made halt till 3 clock half hour paſt time army marched battlearray come near zenta could perceive two thouſand enemy horſe van courriers alſo reported viewed turk bridge troop continually paſſing inſomuch great deal confuſion upon bridge upon prince eugenius took three regigiments dragoon wing two ſecond line flank ſome piece cannon putting himſelf head detachment entrenchment army acted together equal force poſſible reſtrain soldier one part cavalry alighted horſes paſſed moat ſlain enemy mean time german left wing flank cut turk way bridge whence followed moſt horrible slaughter well within entrenchment upon bridge river threw themſelves eſcape imperialiſts soldier ſo eager blood gave quarter body neither baſſas officer tho promiſed large ranſoms hence came paſs ſo priſoners taken thoſe ſuch found among slain bark compoſed bridge thoſe underſtood turkiſh infantry fight ſide river 2000 men grand seignior guard whence may concluded foot deſtroyd ſeveral thouſands ſlain fight ended day ſufficiently ſet forth valour courage general officer soldier higheſt loweſt principally skill dexterity prince eugenius extolled tho much inferiour enemy knew country love ti deſign burthen bring abundance along wealth force belongs augment much lie glory honour nation fighting againſt enemy kingdom moreeſpecially thoſe chriſtendom aſſurd heart ſhall always ſtill innumerable difficulty ſtruggle poland saxony ſelf alſo taken care wherefore leaſt ſudden change religion ſhould occaſion innovation cauſed following declaration affixed upon gate dreſden frederick auguſtus grace god king poland c elector saxony c notifie make known long ſince divine inſpiration reſolvd return boſom roman church wherein anceſtors livd whereas purpoſe without allurement intereſt profit god eye embracd catholick apoſtolick roman religion mean pleaſed divine majeſty advance perſon throne poland reaſon find ſelves obligd affair ſo great importance abſent ſelves ſome preſent act promiſe hand seald seal lobſow auguſt 6 1697 • avgvstvs k poland e saxony prince conti mean time buoyd primate party september 6th left france 25th arrived danzick city refuſed men liberty landing adherd firmly intereſt elector laſt ſolemnly crowned king cracow september 15 undoubtedly muſt great mortification prince conti however totally diſcouraged aſſurance lithuanian army would ſubmit new crownd king intention farther ſtill embroil matter wrote following letter party ſedulous diſperſe copy francis lewis de bourbon prince conti grace god affection poliſh nation elect king firſt built chriſtian majeſty right hand rhine intire without demoliſhing thing thereof fort pille others raiſed iſles rhine ſhall totally razed within month ſooner poſſible ſole expence charge chriſtian king new raiſed rebuilt hereafter either party relates navigation uſage cuſtoms river ſhall free open subject party ſhall mind paſs ſail convey merchandize way without permiſſion allowed
